Game

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Models the Goban used in a game of go.
    Author:
    luuk.bosch

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Creates a default board with size 9*9.
      Board(int size)
      creates a empty goban board of a specific size.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createBoard()
      Creates all the Intersection instances an places them in the right position in the stones array.
      Intersection[][] getBoard()
      Returns the array containing all the intersections.
      Board getDeepcopy()
      Returns a deepcopy of the Goban.
      Intersection getField(int row, int col)
      returns the Intersection for a given row and column number.
      java.lang.String getMark(Intersection stone)
      returns a simple string representation of a stone.
      int getSize()
      returns the size(N) of the Goban.
      java.lang.String getStringRepresentation()
      Returns a string representation of the Goban.
      boolean isEmptyField(int row, int col)
      Checks if a field is empty or not.
      boolean isField(Intersection intersection)
      checks if a specific intersection is part of the Goban.
      boolean isField(int row, int col)
      checks if a field is part of the Goban.
      void setField(int row, int col, int color)
      Places a "stone" with a specific color on an Intersection.
      java.lang.String toString()
      returns a simple string representation of the Goban.

      • setField

        public void setField(int row,
                     int col,
                     int color)
        Places a "stone" with a specific color on an Intersection. When the stone is placed all the neighbours are checked. if the neighbouring Intersections have the same color the groups are merged. When they have a different color the liberty of this group is removed.
        Parameters:
        row -
        col -
        color -

      • getStringRepresentation

        public java.lang.String getStringRepresentation()
        Returns a string representation of the Goban. Reading from left to right, top to bottom. 0 represents empty, 1 represents black, 2 represents white.
        Returns:

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        returns a simple string representation of the Goban.
